docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: Destrix is a developer-focused admin system on Roblox, making it easier for developers who want a flexible and non-disruptive admin/moderation system in their game, for free.

docs.title: How to get Destrix
docs.text:
"How do you get Destrix for your game?"

You can grab the Destrix model from this link, or download the loader here.

docs.title: What is it?
docs.text: The Destrix API Module (DAX, also referred to as DAXM) is module that helps scripts to easily interact with and control Destrix from the server side. Not to be confused with DXCA, the Destrix Client API Module.

docs.title: What can it do?
docs.text: DAX can do basic tasks like disabling commands for certain permission levels, hiding the panel temporarily, etc.

docs.title: However, it can't...
docs.text:
• Modify user settings or data
  • Listen to requests made by the client
  • Modify settings that you have set in Configurations

docs.title: What should it be used for?
docs.text: DAX should be used for UX (User Experience) improvements (i.e., hiding panels during loading screens and cutscenes, disabling commands that may break other scripts, etc.). You can also use DAX to get things like bans or command logs from it.

docs.title: Security (on your end)
docs.text: It is highly encouraged that you minimise interactions with DAX through remote events fired by a client. Try detecting when a user is in an event on the server's side (i.e. when they enter a portal). If a remote event is required, then you can, but never have a remote event that can disable anything for other players. Also delete any remote events interfacing with DAX if they are no longer fired by the client.

docs.title: Security (on our end)
docs.text: Having DAX in your game is low-risk due to the fact that it mainly only interferes with itself and Destrix. If there are any bugs at all, please report them at destrix.app/report at your earliest convenience.

docs.title: Command Types
docs.text:
Please note that these are not final and maybe be further changed.

This page contains all the command types used in Destrix. Command types are a more accurate label of commands, they are not categories.

Name Examples Description Added Limit ui-interference /hideui, /showui Commands that interfere with other game UI. 2 Jan, 2022 None character-interference-2 /kill, /fling, /sit Commands that can move, damage/kill, morph, or add animations to characters. 10 Apr, 2023 None character-interference-1 /paint, /bighead Commands that change the appearance of characters in a small way. 10 Apr, 2023 None moderation-2 /softban Small moderation commands like /softban (server bans). 10 Apr, 2023 None moderation-1 /kick, /ban Moderation commands. Can only be disabled by the Destrix system to prevent attacks. 10 Apr, 2023 0 seconds ^ server-interference /shutdown Commands that may stop servers or reboot them. 10 Apr, 2023 60 seconds * software /admins, /cmds Commands that are for using Destrix easier. docs.title: DAX:DisableEXEType
docs.text:
DisableEXEType is the function responsible for disable commands by type. Rather than disabling individual commands, you can disable them by codes. These are not the same as categories. All the codes are:

ui-interference example example

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
DAX:DisableEXEType("ui-interference")

The above disables all of the commands that interfere with user interface not from Destrix.

DAX:DisableEXEType("ui-interference", {game.Players.WWolfite})

The above disables all of the commands that interfere with user interface not from Destrix just for WWolfite (game.Players.WWolfite)
